flow.descriptionCdata:
26fc8ea5-7e61-485e-a9bd-a70c4c6b85a8.03cc6121-ab14-4f68-ba22-9cb8106ef960.description=Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested. Input Parameters\: serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow VCenterHost - vCenter host to execute against VCenterUsername - vCenter username VCenterPassword - vCenter password. virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed. dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have. memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have. addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm. Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: NA 26fc8ea5-7e61-485e-a9bd-a70c4c6b85a8.242a50df-2080-4dba-9220-d0b8b404ca2f.description=
Checks if a number or word is greater than another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 > value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
26fc8ea5-7e61-485e-a9bd-a70c4c6b85a8.2cc557b2-14b0-41c6-87e5-2e50b6893efd.description=
Retrieves the configured memory size for a virtual machine in megabytes.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).

Responses\:
success - Successfully retrieved the number of megabytes of memory configured for the virtual machine.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
vmMemorySize - Megabytes of memory configured for the virtual machine

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
26fc8ea5-7e61-485e-a9bd-a70c4c6b85a8.4d626d6f-6e39-413a-9eed-05bfa969b90f.description=
Checks if a number or word is less than another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 < value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
26fc8ea5-7e61-485e-a9bd-a70c4c6b85a8.53d2188e-d180-4694-9f84-309da46c0749.description=
Checks if a number or word is less than another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 < value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
26fc8ea5-7e61-485e-a9bd-a70c4c6b85a8.5b735ccb-f601-4b67-884e-3e98b0d579d5.description=
Subtracts two numbers

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The difference of the two numbers.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
26fc8ea5-7e61-485e-a9bd-a70c4c6b85a8.description=
This flow runs a flex up memory or a flex down memory action on a target VM. The user input for memoryInMb is taken as the desired state of the target VM. If the desired state and the actual state is the same, then the user input is ignored.

Inputs\:
host		\: The hostname or IP address of the vCenter provider
user		\: The name of the user account to login to the vCenter provider
password		\: The password of the user account to login to the vCenter provider
memSize		\: The memory in MB that the server should be flex to
virtualMachine	\: The ID of the target VM on which flex memory action should be run
vmDatacenter	\: The name of the data center that contains the target VM
port		\: The port used by the vCenter provider
protocol		\: The protocol used by the vCenter provider
availableMemory	\: The memory that is available for flex operations on the vCenter provider. If set to -1, then the vCenter will not be checked to see if it has the memory required for a successful flex up memory action.

Response\:
success		\: Flex memory action succeeded for the target VM
ignored		\: Flex memory action was not executed on the target VM as it has the same memory configuration as the desired configuration
failure		\: Flex memory failed on the target VM
flow.name: vCenter Flex Memory

step.name: Subtract VM Memory from User Input
Is Available Memory Less Than 0 (used as a flag)
